DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate efficacy safety QVA149 ( 110/50 μg o.d . ) v tiotropium ( 18 µg o.d . ) + salmeterol/fluticasone propionate FDC ( 50/500 µg b.i.d . ) patient moderate severe COPD
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Efficacy Safety QVA149 ( 110/50 μg o.d . ) v Tiotropium ( 18 µg o.d . ) + Salmeterol/Fluticasone Propionate FDC ( 50/500 µg b.i.d . ) Patients With Moderate Severe COPD
DOC.criteria: Patients sign Informed Consent Form prior initiation studyrelated procedure . Male female adult age ≥ 40 year . Patients moderate severe airflow obstruction stable COPD ( Stage 2 Stage 3 ) accord 2014 GOLD Guidelines . Patients postbronchodilator FEV1 ≥40 < 80 % predict normal value , postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC < 0.70 runin Visit 101 . ( Post refers 15 min inhalation 400 µg salbutamol ) . Current exsmokers smoke history least 10 pack year ( e.g . 10 pack year = 1 pack /day x 10 year , ½ pack/day x 20 year ) . An exsmoker define patient smoke ≥ 6 month screen . Patients triple treatment least last 6 month ( LAMA +LABA/ICS ) . Patients achieve acceptable spirometry result Visit 101 accordance ATS ( American Thoracic Society ) /ERS ( European Respiratory Society ) criteria acceptability ( one retest may perform patient n't meet acceptability criterion ) . Patients one COPD exacerbation require treatment antibiotic and/or oral corticosteroid and/or hospitalization last year prior Visit 1 . Patients develop COPD exacerbation severity either 6 week screen ( Visit 1 ) screening ( Visit 1 ) treatment ( Visit 201 ) eligible permit rescreened minimum 6 week resolution COPD exacerbation . Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply
